page.title: 03North Cornwall weather
page.content:
My sister and I took part in the "Acid Rain Project", run by the Watch Trust for Environmental Education Ltd.
We recorded the acidity of rain and snow in our garden between Jan 14th and Feb 10th 1985. We checked the quantity of rainfall in a sterile container and used ph sticks to measure the acidity. The lowest level of acidity that we recorded was {3.6ph A total of 8,000 children around the country took part and the results were analyzed by Dr. Neil Cape of the Institute of Terrestrial Ecology.
This goes to prove that our isolation is no guarantee of immunity from this ecological problem.
